0.title: Imprisoned Russian activist Vladimir Kara-Murza gets human rights award
0.article_body: The UN Watch honoured an imprisoned Russian opposition activist, Vladimir Kara-Murza, with its highest human rights award. Kara-Murza's wife, Evgenia Kara-Murza, accepted the award and read out a letter that her husband had written in jail. "Since February, over 19,000 people were detained by police across Russia for anti-war protests...I want to dedicate this award to...them," he wrote.

1.title: Suspect, his family members booked for assaulting bailiff in Gurugram
1.article_body: A suspect and his family members were booked for allegedly assaulting a court official when he tried to execute a conditional arrest warrant issued by a Gurugram court, police said on Thursday. The alleged incident occurred on September 26 in Gurugram's Palam Vihar. The bailiff had reached Parveen Yadav's residence to take him to be produced before the court.

2.title: Habitual offender held in Mumbai, foreigner's stolen bag recovered in 6 hrs
2.article_body: Government Railway Police (GRP) in Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus arrested a habitual offender for stealing the bag of a New Zealand national, containing valuables worth â‚¹2.8 lakh, within six hours of the crime. The bag was stolen after the complainant kept it in a locker in the waiting room. Police examined CCTV footage and arrested the accused from Borivali.

3.title: Expecto Patrol-lus: Mumbai Police in Harry Potter-themed vigilance post
3.article_body: Mumbai Police took to social media to share a Harry Potter-themed post on vigilance. "Think you can manage mischief? Not on our watch! Always expect our patrol. We don't need any 'magic' to protect you!" they wrote. The police also used 'Mumbai Police on Watch', 'Anything For Mumbai' and 'Constant Vigilance' hashtags.

4.title: China should pay up for climate damage: German Development Minister
4.article_body: German Development Minister Svenja Schulze said China should contribute more to compensation payments for nations hit by climate-fuelled disasters. "China has 28% of greenhouse gas emissions at the moment. So they must...contribute to dealing with the damage," she added, saying, "They always hide behind the fact that they're a developing nation. But de facto they're no longer a developing nation."

5.title: IAS officer shares pics to announce Guj poll duty on Insta, removed from posting
5.article_body: IAS officer Abhishek Singh has been relieved of his poll duties for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections after he shared pictures and announced the posting on Instagram, multiple reports said on Friday. Pics he posted showed him posing with other poll officials and an armed security official. Election Commission reportedly said Singh used his official position "as a publicity stunt".

6.title: People won't forgive insults: MP CM on Rahul's remarks against Savarkar
6.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan criticised Congress MP Rahul Gandhi over his comments against freedom fighter VD Savarkar and said that people won't forgive insults. "Will the country tolerate the kind of statements Rahul Gandhi is making against Veer Savarkar? Congress has always honoured Nehru family. Have they ever counted contributions of...Sardar Patel?" said Chouhan.

7.title: K'taka Cong MLA gets death threat over proposed Tipu Sultan statue
7.article_body: Karnataka Congress on Thursday shared a video of a pro-Hindutva group's leader issuing death threat to Congress MLA Tanveer Sait after he announced the installation of a 100-foot-tall statue of Tipu Sultan in Mysuru. The accused warned Sait that "his last rites" would be held if he builds even a one-foot-tall statue of Sultan. Sait has lodged a police complaint.

8.title: Govt raises maximum tenure of PSU banks' CEO, MD to 10 years
8.article_body: The maximum tenure of the CEO and MD of public sector banks has been increased to 10 years from five years, subject to the superannuation age of 60 years. This is also applicable to whole-time directors of all Central Public Sector Enterprises. The amendment would be called Nationalised Banks (Management and Miscellaneous Provisions) Amendment Scheme, 2022, a government notification said.

9.title: Twitter staff left meeting even as Musk tried to convince them to stay: Report
9.article_body: Elon Musk reportedly held meetings with some employees who are considered key to Twitter's operations to try to persuade them to stay amid mass resignations on Thursday. However, some employees left the meeting being held via videoconference even as Musk continued speaking, the NYT reported. Earlier, Musk gave an ultimatum to employees to either commit to "hardcore" culture, or leave.

10.title: Educated girls shouldn't be in live-in relationships: Union Minister
10.article_body: Talking about Shraddha Walkar murder case, Union Minister Kaushal Kishore on Thursday said that educated girls should not get into live-in relationships. Such relationships are "giving rise to crime", he added. Reacting to it, Shiv Sena leader Priyanka Chaturvedi tweeted, "If [PM Narendra Modi] really means what he says about women Shakti, then he must sack this Union Minister immediately."

11.title: Historic moment: PM on successful launch of India's 1st private rocket
11.article_body: PM Narendra Modi called the successful launch of India's first privately developed rocket, Vikram-S, a historic moment for the nation. "This accomplishment bears testimony to the immense talent of our youth, who took full advantage of the landmark space sector reforms of June 2020," he added. The rocket lifted off from Sriharikota in Andhra Pradesh on Friday.

12.title: BJP calls Kejriwal 'Professor of Corruption' in 'Money Heist' post
12.article_body: After conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar wrote yet another letter accusing AAP of getting involved in corruption, the BJP shared a poster inspired by the Spanish crime series 'Money Heist'. The poster shows Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal along with other leaders, who are being probed for their alleged involvement in various scam cases. The BJP also called Kejriwal 'Professor of Corruption'.

13.title: Paris-inspired bridges to be constructed across Hyd's Musi river
13.article_body: Telangana government will be constructing 'fusion bridges' across Hyderabad's Musi river inspired by bridges across rivers in Paris and other European cities. Telangana minister KT Rama Rao asked officials not to design the bridges exactly like those in Paris, but to design bridges that fit the city's topography. KTR asked officials to ensure that these bridges are futuristic in design.

14.title: Earned â‚¹300-400 in Kolkata, faced food crisis; survived on puchka paani: Big B
14.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said that he faced a lot of food crisis while he was in Kolkata. "In front of Victoria Memorial, there is a place where one can get the world's best panipuri...For the people like us who earned only â‚¹300-400...We would survive on Puchka Paani as it was cheap only for do aana-chaar aana," he added.

15.title: 10 mn left without power in Ukraine as Russia launches new airstrikes
15.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday said that more than 10 million Ukrainians are without electricity after a fresh wave of missile strikes by Russia. "We are doing everything to normalise the supply," he added. At least four people were killed and more than a dozen wounded in Thursday's drone and missile strikes around the country, Ukrainian authorities said.

16.title: Hindu girl killed, cut into pieces by lover in Bangladesh; headless body found in box
16.article_body: A Hindu girl named Kavita Rani was killed and cut into pieces by her lover named Abu Bakr in Bangladesh. Police said they found the headless body of the girl in a box at the house that Abu Bakr had rented. Her head was kept separate, wrapped in polythene. Abu Bakr had also not turned up for work.

17.title: Kartik Aaryan to play a boxer in Kabir Khan's next film: Report
17.article_body: Kartik Aaryan has reportedly been roped in to play a boxer in an upcoming film which will be helmed by Kabir Khan. According to a report, the actor has already begun training under Rahul Bhatt, who previously trained Aamir Khan for 'Dangal'. "He'll be following...months of a strict exercise regime...to acquire a boxer's physique," a source was quoted as saying.

18.title: Certain countries support terrorism as part of their foreign policy: PM Modi
18.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi called for penalising the countries that are financially and politically supporting terrorism. "Terrorist organisations get money [from] several sources. One source is state supportâ€¦It is an attack on humanity, freedom and civilisation. It knows no boundaries...All terrorist attacks deserve equal outrage and action," said the PM.

19.title: Govt teachers told to not drink on duty in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur
19.article_body: District Education Officer (DEO) of Chhattisgarh's Jashpur has issued an order directing government servants who are working in schools and offices to not drink alcohol while on duty. It also asked officials and teachers to submit a self-declaration on the same by November 24. "Multiple instances of inebriated teachers visiting schools and colleges have surfaced...recently," the order stated.

20.title: South India's first Vande Bharat Express train hits calf a week after inauguration
20.article_body: The newly-inaugurated Mysuru-Chennai Vande Bharat Express train hit a cow's calf and suffered a dent near Tamil Nadu's Arakkonam on Thursday. A PRO of Southern Railway's Chennai division confirmed the incident, saying the calf's owner will be traced and booked. The train that is south India's first Vande Bharat was flagged off by PM Narendra Modi on November 11 (Friday).

21.title: Auditioned for Harshaali Malhotra's part in 'Bajrangi...': 'Drishyam' actress
21.article_body: 'Drishyam' actress Mrunal Jadhav revealed that she had auditioned for Harshaali Malhotra's part in the film 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan'. "But I couldn't get the part as I wasn't that fair and hence, wouldn't have suited the part of the Pakistani girl," she added. "Then the same casting people were working on Drishyam as well, for which they signed me," Mrunal said.

22.title: Terrorism should not be linked to any religion, nationality: Amit Shah
22.article_body: While addressing a conference, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that terrorism should not be linked to any religion, nationality, or group. He added that terrorists are constantly finding new ways to carry out violence, radicalise youth and raise financial resources. "Terrorism is, undoubtedly, the most serious threat to global peace and security," Shah further said.

23.title: Man on Pune-Mumbai train injured in stone pelting near Lonavala
23.article_body: A man on the Pune-Mumbai Sinhagad Express was injured after being hit by a stone near Lonavala on Friday morning. The passenger suffered an injury on his head when some people by the railway track hurled stones at the passing train. Earlier this month, three passengers on a Mumbai local suburban train were injured in a similar incident near Kalwa.

24.title: TRS workers allegedly vandalise BJP MP's Hyderabad house; video surfaces
24.article_body: TRS workers allegedly attacked and vandalised BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri's residence in Hyderabad on Friday. A video of the incident has surfaced online. This comes after Dharmapuri claimed that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao's daughter and TRS MLC K Kavitha wanted to join Congress as she was upset with her father and she'd called up Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge.

25.title: India not a viable market for crypto: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao
25.article_body: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao said he doesn't consider India a very crypto-friendly environment. At a TechCrunch event, Zhao said India's high tax environment on cryptocurrency is a concern as it contributes to market's lack of viability for foreign competitors. "If you are going to tax 1% on each transaction, there is not going to be that many transactions," he said.

26.title: How does it matter if 1-2 films out of 100-150 don't work: Ajay on Himmatwala
26.article_body: While appearing on 'The Kapil Sharma Show', actor Ajay Devgn asked how does it matter if one or two films out of 100-150 films don't work. This came as a response to Kapil saying that 'Himmatwala' did not work at the box office. Kapil told Ajay he also has a 50 per cent working rate for films.

27.title: Kalinga Stadium is one of world's best hockey stadiums: Ex-player
27.article_body: Former India fullback VR Raghunath said that the atmosphere at Bhubaneswar's Kalinga Stadium is very different from other stadiums. "Having played in Germany, Holland and other countries, I can safely say that the Kalinga Stadium is one of the best in the world," Raghunath said. Notably, the Kalinga Stadium will host the upcoming FIH Men's Hockey World Cup 2023.

28.title: Theranos' Holmes seeks leniency ahead of sentencing in fraud trial over pregnancy
28.article_body: Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes' lawyers argued that she deserves leniency on the grounds that she is a devoted mother with another child on the way. Holmes was found guilty on four counts of wire fraud and conspiracy related to her now-defunct blood-testing startup. She faces sentencing on Friday, which could go up to 20 years in prison for each count.

29.title: 27-hr mega block due to Mumbai's Carnac bridge demolition to start tomorrow
29.article_body: A 27-hour mega block in view of demolition of British-era Carnac Bridge in Mumbai will begin on Saturday night. Block on Up and Down Slow and Fast lines of Central Railway will be from 11 pm tomorrow till 4 pm on Sunday. Block on Up and Down Harbour lines will be from 11 pm tomorrow till 8 pm on Sunday.

30.title: Man who pushed girl to death in Lucknow arrested after encounter
30.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Police arrested Sufiyan after an encounter on Friday. He was accused of pushing a girl to death from the fourth floor of a building in Lucknow earlier this week. A case of murder and caste conversion was lodged. He has been hospitalised at the trauma centre of King George's Medical University as he sustained a bullet injury.

31.title: Saudi Crown Prince should be immune from lawsuit in Khashoggi's killing: US
31.article_body: The Biden administration has declared that Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince should be considered immune from a lawsuit over his role in Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi's killing. In a turnaround, the US government said that the high office held by Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince should shield him from lawsuits. The lawsuit has been brought by the slain journalist's fiancÃ©e Hatice Cengiz.

32.title: Up to â‚¹500 crore fine for non-compliance proposed in draft Data Protection Bill
32.article_body: The government on Friday released the draft Digital Personal Data Protection Bill 2022 for public views. The bill proposes penalty of up to â‚¹500 crore on an individual or a company for non-compliance. It further requires a data fiduciary to give an itemised notice to user on data sought to be collected and mandates the user's right to withdraw consent.

33.title: India's Manika beats world no. 7 Xingtong in ITTF-ATTU Asian Cup 1st round
33.article_body: Indian table tennis player Manika Batra defeated world number seven Chen Xingtong 4-3 (8-11, 11-9, 11-6, 11-6, 9-11, 8-11, 11-9) in women's singles first round of ITTF-ATTU Asian Cup in Bangkok on Thursday. In men's singles first round, Sathiyan Gnanasekaran and Sharath Kamal lost  3-4 and 1-4 respectively. World number 44 Manika will face Chinese Taipei's Chen Szu-Yu in quarter-final.

34.title: Mahatma Gandhi's great-grandson joins Rahul in Bharat Jodo Yatra
34.article_body: Mahatma Gandhi's great-grandson Tushar Gandhi joined Congress leader and former PM Jawaharlal Nehru's great-grandson Rahul Gandhi in the Bharat Jodo Yatra at Shegaon in Maharashtra's Buldhana district on Friday. Hailing the development as historic, the Congress party said, "Gandhi-Nehru have always come together to save the country in difficult times."

35.title: 25-year-old man beaten, stabbed to death by colleagues in Palghar
35.article_body: A 25-year-old man was allegedly beaten and stabbed to death by three of his colleagues in the Kaman area of Vasai in Maharashtra's Palghar district. The victim Jaynato Nimai Mandal was employed as a construction worker, police said. Mandal was killed over a petty dispute, police added. The accused have been booked under IPC Section 302 (murder).

36.title: Parts of Bengaluru to see scheduled power cuts this weekend
36.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will see power cuts between 10 am and 4 pm this weekend as power suppliers BESCOM and KPTCL will undertake maintenance projects. On Friday, areas such as Kukkanahalli and Bolamaranahalli will be impacted, while on Saturday, BT Layout, KR Road and other areas will be affected. Many places, including Huskur and Islampura, will be impacted on Sunday.

37.title: Pak's desperate attempts to peddle falsehoods deserve contempt & some sympathy: India
37.article_body: India has criticised Pakistan after it spoke about the Jammu and Kashmir issue during a plenary meeting of the UN General Assembly. India's Permanent Mission to the UN Pratik Mathur said, "Pakistan's desperate attempts to peddle falsehoods and a bad habit of abusing the sanctity of multilateral forums deserve our collective contempt and perhaps some sympathy as well."

38.title: Kherson residents exchange Russian SIM cards for Ukrainian ones
38.article_body: Days after Ukrainian forces regained control over Kherson, hundreds of residents queued up in rain to exchange their Russian SIM cards for Ukrainian ones. Ukraine's local telecoms providers have set up booths where residents could either get a free SIM card or pay to skip the queue. The Ukrainian government said Russian troops destroyed telecommunications system in Kherson before leaving.

39.title: I said to myself it's going to be one of those tournaments: Warner on T20 WC
39.article_body: Talking about his 2022 T20 World Cup performance, Australia's David Warner said he knew it was going to be "one of those tournaments" after he was dismissed for five runs in their opening game against New Zealand. "I don't know why but that's the game of cricket," he added. Warner scored 44 runs in his four innings in the tournament.

40.title: Thai police fire rubber bullets amid protest against APEC summit in Bangkok
40.article_body: Thai police fired rubber bullets to disperse a protest against the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in Bangkok, a police official said. Around 350 protesters clashed with the police about 10 km from the venue where APEC leaders were meeting. Some demonstrators carried signs with phrases such as "Expel PM Prayut Chan-o-cha" and "Free Hong Kong".

41.title: Shraddha was hospitalised for 3 days in 2020, friends say she was assaulted by Aftab
41.article_body: Shraddha Walkar, who was murdered in Delhi by her live-in boyfriend Aftab Ameen Poonawala, was hospitalised for three days in Vasai in 2020, with her friends saying that she was assaulted by Aftab. A hospital report stated she had severe back pain, neck pain and nausea, among other issues. A doctor reportedly said that she had internal injuries.

42.title: Rare horn grows on 91-year-old woman's arm in Taiwan; doctor shares pic
42.article_body: A doctor in Taiwan has shared a picture of a rare horn growing on a 91-year-old woman's arm. It is seven centimetres long and four centimetres in width, the doctor said in a Facebook post. The woman lives in the city of Changhua and is being treated in the local Xiuchuan Hospital for the abnormal growth.

43.title: Others started taking stand way before you: Varun to Kriti on industry pay
43.article_body: While talking about industry pay standards for female stars, actor Varun Dhawan said that his other female co-stars started taking a stand way before actress Kriti Sanon. Kriti reportedly thanked Varun for telling her that she should demand remuneration that she feels best represents what she brings to the table. "You have to take a stand," Varun said.

44.title: North Korean missile had the range to reach US mainland: Japan
44.article_body: A suspected intercontinental ballistic missile fired on Friday by North Korea had sufficient range to reach the US mainland and was capable of flying as far as 15,000 km, Japanese Defence Minister Yasukazu Hamada said. The test missile travelled 1,000 km on a lofted trajectory and landed about 200 km west of Oshima-Oshima island in Japan's Hokkaido, Japanese officials said.

45.title: TRS workers vandalise BJP MP's house in Hyd; BJP MP shares pics
45.article_body: TRS workers allegedly attacked and vandalised BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri's residence in Hyderabad on Friday. Following the incident, Dharmapuri shared pictures of his house and tweeted, "[TRS workers] terrorised my mother and created ruckus." This comes after Dharmapuri alleged that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao's daughter and TRS MLC K Kavitha had called up Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge.

46.title: Farooq hasn't resigned as JKNC Prez, he won't seek re-election: Omar
46.article_body: Dismissing reports of his father Dr Farooq Abdullah resigning as President of the Jammu Kashmir National Conference (JKNC) party, former J&K CM Omar Abdullah said on Friday that the former will merely not seek re-election. Omar urged his party colleagues to file nominations for the post of the president so that the best person can lead JKNC through "turbulent times".

47.title: Google agreed to pay Activision $360 mn to stop app store competition: Epic Games
47.article_body: 'Fortnite' developer Epic Games has accused Google of making deals with at least 24 app developers to stop them from competing with its Play Store. In a court filing in US, Epic said Google agreed to pay Activision Blizzard $360 million after the game publisher discussed launching its own app store. Riot Games also allegedly signed a deal with Google.

48.title: Australian PM Anthony Albanese to visit India in March
48.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese said that he will visit India in March next year to sign India-Australia Economic Cooperation and Trade Agreement and strengthen ties between the two countries. Albanese added that PM Narendra Modi will visit Australia in 2023 for Quad Leadership Summit. Albanese met PM Modi on the sidelines of the G20 summit in Bali on November 16.

49.title: Anil Agarwal meets WEF Chief, talks about India's role in global recovery
49.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal took to Twitter and posted a picture of his meeting with World Economic Forum (WEF) President BÃ¸rge Brende. "He was so warm & friendly...We talked about how India is in a bright spot with our economy heading in a strong direction...and the role India will play in global recovery ahead of our G20 Presidency," Agarwal tweeted.

50.title: Gautam Buddha Nagar Police arrest man for assaulting security guard at mall
50.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police arrested a resident of Greater Noida for allegedly assaulting a security guard inside a shopping mall. "An argument broke out after the security guard asked [the accused] to leave the mall as he was allegedly [drunk]â€¦[The accused] attacked the security guard and punched him multiple times on his face and head," said a police officer.

51.title: Anti-encroachment drive starts at premises of Pune's Sinhagad Fort
51.article_body: The Maharashtra Forest Department started its anti-encroachment drive at the premises of Sinhagad Fort in Pune on Friday, Deputy Conservator of Forests (Territorial) Pune Rahul Patil said. As many as 135 illegal stalls which have been set up around the fort will be removed during the drive. A team of police personnel have also been deployed in the area.

52.title: 9-yr-old girl dies after crude bombs kept in kitchen explode in WB
52.article_body: A nine-year-old girl died in a crude bomb blast after she allegedly picked up the bombs that were kept in the loft of the kitchen of her maternal uncle's house in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas, police said on Thursday. "The girl thought that coconuts were kept in the loft," a police officer said. The maternal uncle has been arrested.

53.title: 25-yr-old man dancing on moving truck dies after being hit by a bridge in US
53.article_body: A 25-year-old man who was filmed dancing on top of a moving truck in Texas has died after he slammed into an oncoming bridge. Footage recorded by the driver of another vehicle on the freeway shows the man climbing on top of the truck and dancing before being knocked off the vehicle. The incident took place on November 10.

54.title: India-NZ T20I abandoned without a ball being bowled due to rain in Wellington
54.article_body: The first T20I between India and New Zealand in Wellington has been abandoned without a ball being bowled due to rain. The match was called off more than an hour before the cut-off time. The second match of the three-match series is scheduled to take place on Sunday in Mount Maunganui.

55.title: Aftab killed Shraddha under influence of weed, threw some body parts in Dehradun: Reports
55.article_body: Aftab Amin Poonawala, who is accused of killing his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar, told police that he is addicted to marijuana and killed Shraddha under the influence of weed on May 18, according to reports quoting sources. During interrogation, he also told police officials that he threw some body parts in Dehradun, sources said.

56.title: Coach tried to put me in for 3 mins in the end: Ronaldo on leaving early vs Spurs
56.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo has revealed that he left the game early against Tottenham Hotspur because he "felt provoked" by coach Erik ten Hag. "You don't put me against Manchester City because of respect for [my] career and you want to put me three minutes against Tottenham. It doesn't make sense...I think he did it on purpose," stated Ronaldo.

57.title: Complaint filed against Rahul Gandhi over remarks against VD Savarkar
57.article_body: Balasahebanchi ShivSena leader Vandana Dongre filed a complaint against Congress MP Rahul Gandhi for allegedly making derogatory remarks against freedom fighter VD Savarkar. "Sentiments of the local citizens have been hurtâ€¦We will not tolerate the defamation of our great men [on] the soil of Maharashtra," said Dongre. The party also protested against Rahul Gandhi in Thane on Thursday.

58.title: Shop owners attack Gurugram civic officials, police; FIR filed
58.article_body: Shop owners and their employees allegedly assaulted officials of the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) and police personnel during an anti-encroachment drive in Sadar Bazar. An FIR was filed against the suspects following the incident. An inspector said that some shopkeepers have also filed complaints against the MCG team and police, adding, "We'll get...allegations probed simultaneously."

59.title: UP Police announces â‚¹25,000 for info on man who pushed girl to death
59.article_body: UP Police has announced a reward of â‚¹25,000 for information on Sufiyan, who is accused of pushing a minor girl to death in Lucknow. Nine teams have been formed to arrest Sufiyan. Earlier, police said the accused had been trying to befriend the victim for the last one-and-a-half years. A case under sections of murder and caste conversion was lodged.

60.title: Crypto firm Genesis sought $1 bn loan before suspending withdrawals: Report
60.article_body: Cryptocurrency lender Genesis sought an emergency loan of $1 billion from investors ahead of suspending withdrawals, The Wall Street Journal reported citing a confidential document. It mentioned that there was a "liquidity crunch due to...illiquid assets on its balance sheet". A Genesis spokesperson reportedly said that the firm is having "very positive conversations" with potential investors.

61.title: 507 arrested in illegal religious conversion cases in UP: Official
61.article_body: As many as 291 cases of illegal religious conversion have been registered and over 507 people have been arrested in Uttar Pradesh since Prohibition of Illegal Religious Conversion Act came into force, said a government official. Bareilly district accounts for the maximum number of such cases, he added. Victims in 150 cases said they were forced to convert.

62.title: We're good at donning a mask, what's in the heart isn't out there: Bhumika
62.article_body: Actress Bhumika Chawla said that sometimes being clicked by photographers is good but not always. "We are so good at donning a mask as soon as we see cameras that what is in the heart is not out there and true. Therefore, sometimes it's good, but if always, then it can be unreal," she added.

63.title: US-based firm Soft Robotics raises $26 mn led by Tyson Ventures
63.article_body: US-based robotic automation company for food and consumer goods Soft Robotics has secured $26 million in Series C funding round led by Tyson Ventures, an arm of Tyson Foods. New investors including Marel and Johnsonville also participated. Soft Robotics was founded by George M Whitesides of Harvard University. In January 2020, the firm raised $23 million in Series B round.

64.title: Meta fires employees, security guards for hijacking user accounts: WSJ
64.article_body: Meta has fired or disciplined over two dozen employees and contractors over the last year who were accused of improperly taking over user accounts, the WSJ reported citing sources. In some cases, the workers accepted bribes from outside hackers. Some of those fired were contractors who worked as security guards and were given access to the firms' internal mechanism 'Oops'.

65.title: SpaceX staff fired for criticising Musk file unfair labour practices charges in US
65.article_body: A group of former SpaceX employees has filed unfair labour practices charges against the firm claiming they were allegedly fired after they wrote and circulated an open letter criticising CEO Elon Musk. They had written the open letter after reports claimed Musk had exposed his genitals to a flight attendant and asked her for sex. Musk has denied the allegations.

66.title: Musk says Twitter usage has hit another all-time high, Binance CEO reacts
66.article_body: Twitter CEO Elon Musk on Friday informed that Twitter's usage hit another all-time high and Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao reacted to Musk's tweet. "The more successful you are, the more people FUD (fear, uncertainty and doubt) about you. FUD makes you stronger, not weaker," wrote Zhao. Notably, Binance had invested $500 million in Musk's $44 billion deal to buy Twitter.

67.title: Twitter app 'at risk of breaking' after hundreds of employees resign: Report
67.article_body: After hundreds of Twitter employees were estimated to have resigned on Thursday, there was "no one left to fix things in many areas" at the company, Reuters reported. The version of Twitter app used by employees began slowing down on Friday and the public version was at risk of breaking, the publication quoted a source as saying.

68.title: Argentina's Correa, Almada get mobbed by fans before flight to Qatar for FIFA WC
68.article_body: Argentina players Angel Correa and Thiago Almada were mobbed by hundreds of fans at the airport before they took off for the upcoming FIFA World Cup in Qatar. A video from the airport went viral, showing fans trying to take selfies with the footballers. They were called up after Nicolas Gonzalez and Joaquin Correa were ruled out of the tournament.

69.title: Facebook to remove religious views and 'interested in' info from profiles
69.article_body: Facebook will be removing four information fields from profiles, which include religious views, political views, addresses and the 'interested in' field, which indicates a user's sexual orientation,  starting next month. The platform is doing so "to make Facebook easier to navigate and use". Users who have filled the fields on their profiles will get notifications regarding the change.

70.title: Anyone who supports radicalisation should have no place in any country: PM
70.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday said that anyone who supports radicalisation should have "no place in any country". PM Modi made the remark while addressing the 'No Money for Terror' conference in Delhi. Adding that only a "uniform and unified" zero-tolerance approach can defeat terrorism, PM Modi further said that a cost must be imposed on countries that support terrorism.

71.title: Told parents to not look at me as though I'm next, I've time: Sunny on marriage
71.article_body: Actor Sunny Kaushal said that he has told his parents to not look at him as though he is next in line for marriage. "I have a lot of time...before that," he added. On rumours of him dating actress Sharvari Wagh, he said, "It would be stupid of us to make it...a reality and take it very seriously," he added.

72.title: Mumbai man pushes girlfriend off water tank of 15th-floor building, arrested
72.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 25-year-old man, who works for a BPO, for allegedly pushing his girlfriend off the water tank located on the terrace of a 15th-floor residential building on Sunday. He was booked for attempt to murder, police said. The victim's father claimed the accused was drunk and pushed her after an argument. She has suffered grievous injuries.

73.title: Rahul needs to do 'Congress Jodo', not 'Bharat Jodo': Hardik Patel
73.article_body: BJP leader Hardik Patel said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi needs to undertake "Congress Jodo" exercise instead of Bharat Jodo Yatra. Patel, who quit Congress earlier this year, said, "The question is whether Rahul Gandhi will come [to Gujarat] after the elections or before the elections." "The people of Gujarat do not want to entertain Congress," he added.

74.title: Accused wanted compensation for land acquisition: ATS on Udaipur blast
74.article_body: Rajasthan ATS, which is investigating the explosion on a railway track in Udaipur, said the accused held a grudge against Indian Railways and Hindustan Zinc Limited for allegedly not receiving compensation and job for land acquisition. "On the day of the incident, after the train...passed the track around 6 pm, they...planted...explosives," ATS added. Four including a juvenile were detained.

75.title: Fighting fake news and misinformation biggest challenge: I&B Secretary
75.article_body: I&B Secretary Apurva Chandra warned people of fake news and claimed that the major challenge lies in fighting it and protecting the people from misinformation. He further added that the media industry plays a pivotal role in conveying important messages to the public and that it did an excellent job during the COVID-19 pandemic.

76.title: Centre seeks extension from SEBI for IDBI Bank stake sale: Report
76.article_body: The Centre has sought an extension from SEBI to meet the 25% minimum public shareholding (MPS) norm for IDBI Bank after privatisation, CNBC TV-18 quoted sources as saying. If SEBI allows both the government and Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) to be classified as public shareholders, the minimum public shareholding criterion will be met automatically, the report added.

77.title: Musk shares grave meme as #RIPTwitter trends on Twitter amid mass resignations
77.article_body: Twitter CEO Elon Musk shared a meme featuring Twitter on a gravestone as '#RIPTwitter' trended on Twitter amid reports of mass resignations at the company. The resignations came after Musk gave an ultimatum to employees to sign up for "long hours at high intensity", or leave. Musk is reportedly meeting some top employees to try and convince them to stay.

78.title: Jaya asks where I got them from, where will we keep them: Big B on fans' gifts
78.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said that he takes several gifts home every day. "She [wife Jaya Bachchan] asks me where I got the gifts from and I tell her my fans gave them to me. And then she asks where I intend to keep them because we don't have space," he added. He further said the atmosphere of home becomes tense.

79.title: N Korea fires suspected ICBM, Japan says it fell in exclusive economic zone
79.article_body: North Korea fired a suspected intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) on Friday, South Korea's military said. Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said that the North Korean ballistic missile was believed to have fallen in waters within the country's exclusive economic zone (EEZ) off the northern region of Hokkaido. The launch comes a day after North Korea fired a short-range ballistic missile.

80.title: Tharoor shares video of chameleon, says 'Changing colours of political defectors'
80.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Friday called political defectors in India "snollygosters' role model" and shared a video of a chameleon changing its colours as it climbs a multi-coloured stick. "The changing colours of political defectors...[is] brilliantly illustrated by this...chameleon!" he tweeted. As per Merriam-Webster dictionary, 'snollygoster' means a shrewd or unprincipled person.

81.title: Ukraine war is your problem too: French Prez Macron to Asian countries
81.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday urged Asian countries to join "increasing consensus" against the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. The Ukraine war is "your problem" too, Macron told business leaders on the sidelines of an Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in Thailand's capital Bangkok. He further said that the war will create "a lot of destabilisation".

82.title: Indonesia's biggest tech firm GoTo fires 1,300 employees
82.article_body: Indonesia's biggest tech firm GoTo has laid off 1,300 workers, 12% of permanent workforce, to make the company more "agile" and maintain growth amid challenging global economic conditions, the company said. GoTo said it reduced its structural costs by $51 million by the end of its fiscal second quarter. The company had 9,630 permanent employees at the end of June.

83.title: Aftab, Shraddha posed as married couple, fought often: Flat owner near Mumbai
83.article_body: Aftab Poonawala and his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar described themselves as a married couple while taking a residence on rent near Mumbai last year, according to the flat owner. Jayashree Patkar also claimed that Poonawala and Walkar told their real-estate agent that they were going to stay there with other family members.

84.title: Twitter managers falsely saying staff is doing excellent work will be exited: Musk
84.article_body: Twitter CEO Elon Musk told employees in an email, "Any manager who falsely claims that someone reporting to them is doing excellent work or that a given role is essential...will be exited." He said employees can work remotely if their managers vouch for excellence. "If not logistically possible or they've essential personal matters, then staying home is fine," Musk added.

85.title: People of Gujarat will vote for change this time: Cong MP Gaurav Gogoi
85.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly polls, Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi exuded confidence in winning the upcoming election and said that the people of the state want a change this time after a 27-year-long rule. "For the last so many years, people have only seen a BJP government in Gujarat and still there are issues in healthcare and education," said Gogoi.

86.title: Fire erupts in Navjeevan Express pantry car after cooking heater left on
86.article_body: A fire broke out in the pantry car of Ahmedabad-Chennai Navjeevan Express near Andhra Pradesh's Gudur railway junction after a heater used for cooking was allegedly left on. No casualties were reported in the incident, reports said. "The AC supply was also cut and the fire [was] put out," South Central Railway Vijayawada division spokesperson, Nusrat M Mandrupkar, said.

87.title: Girl ragged & forcibly kissed in Odisha college, 5 students arrested
87.article_body: Five students, including two teenagers, allegedly involved in ragging a girl student from the state-run Binayak Acharya College have been arrested by Odisha Police. A viral video of the incident shows the victim being forcibly kissed. â€‹Berhampur SP said the accused will be booked under POCSO Act and IT Act among others. Meanwhile, the college expelled 12 accused students.

88.title: Pilot hangs out of cockpit to collect passenger's mobile from ground staff in US
88.article_body: A pilot was seen hanging out of the cockpit of a Southwest Airlines' plane in US to collect a passenger's mobile from the ground staff. "When our employees...noticed a customer's phone left behind in a gate area after a flight that was already boarded and pushed back from the gate, they didn't hesitate," the airline tweeted along with a video.

89.title: Elgar Parishad accused Anand Teltumbde gets bail from Bombay HC
89.article_body: Bombay High Court on Friday granted bail to Anand Teltumbde, who is an accused in the Bhima Koregaon case. Teltumbde has been allowed bail on â‚¹1 lakh surety, news agency ANI reported. Reports said that the High Court has stayed the order for one week on the request of NIA to appeal in the Supreme Court.

90.title: Chandigarh Reliance store penalised for charging â‚¹5 for carry bag
90.article_body: A Reliance store in Chandigarh's Nexus Elante Mall was asked to pay â‚¹1,000 for harassment and mental agony and â‚¹500 for legal expenses to a man for charging him â‚¹5 for a carry bag. The District Consumer Forum said it "amounts to unfair trade practice". "The opposite parties are minting a lot of money from gullible customers," it added.

91.title: India's first-ever private rocket built by Hyderabad startup launched successfully
91.article_body: India's first-ever privately developed rocket was successfully launched from the ISRO's spaceport in Sriharikota, Andhra Pradesh, on Friday morning. The rocket, named Vikram-S after Vikram Sarabhai, was built by a four-year-old Hyderabad-based startup Skyroot Aerospace. The rocket carrying three payloads was built in two years using composite materials and is equipped with 3D-printed engines.

92.title: 'Rab..' had 'Tani partner...' dialogue: Sulaiman on script inspiring 'Haule..'
92.article_body: Music composer Sulaiman Merchant said that most of the songs that the composers create come out of scripts and situations. "In the film 'Rab Ne Bana Di Jodi', there was a dialogue, 'Tani partner aap dekh lena haule haule ho jaega pyaar'," he added. "Even Suri's character keeps saying, 'Hum hain rahi pyaar ke phir milenge chaltey chaltey'," he said.

93.title: UK backs permanent seat for India, 3 other nations in UN Security Council
93.article_body: The UK has reiterated that permanent seats for India, Germany, Japan and Brazil should be created in the United Nations Security Council. "The UK has long called for the expansion of the Security Council in both the permanent and non-permanent categories," UK's Permanent Representative to the UN Barbara Woodward said. China, France, Russia, UK and US are permanent UNSC members.

94.title: You have selected Samson for NZ T20Is, but where will you play him: Aakash
94.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said that Sanju Samson, who was named in India's squad for New Zealand T20Is, is unlikely to feature in the playing XI. "The earliest place available for Sanju Samson is number six but he might not be useful there. You can play Deepak Hooda there," added Aakash. The first New Zealand-India T20I will be played today.

95.title: Pune traffic policemen must not leave assigned duty spots: DCP
95.article_body: On being questioned about easing the traffic situation in Pune, the city's DCP (Traffic) Vijay Kumar Magar said that top priority will be given to the placement of traffic police personnel at all important chowks and "points of traffic chaos". "Under no circumstances will [traffic policemen] leave their assigned duty spots failing which disciplinary action will be taken," he added.

96.title: 21 people die as fire breaks out at party in refugee camp in Gaza Strip
96.article_body: At least 21 people were killed and several others were injured after a fire broke out at a residential building during a party in a refugee camp in the northern Gaza Strip on Thursday, officials said. A preliminary investigation found a large amount of gasoline inside the building, which contributed to the escalation of the fire, Gaza's Interior Ministry said.

97.title: Nykaa stock up 4% after 54 mn shares change hands in 2 block deals
97.article_body: Nearly 54.2 million shares or 1.9% stake in Nykaa parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures reportedly changed hands via two block deals on Friday. Following this, its stock gained as much as 4% to â‚¹192.75/share. Citigroup launched a block deal to sell Nykaa shares worth â‚¹1,000 crore on behalf of TPG Capital. At 10:45 am, stock was trading 3.10% higher on NSE.

98.title: FTX's corporate funds were used to buy homes for staff in Bahamas: New CEO
98.article_body: FTX's new CEO John Ray has claimed that the bankrupt crypto exchange's corporate funds were used to purchase homes and other personal items for employees and advisors in the Bahamas. "There does not appear to be documentation for certain of these transactions as loans," Ray said. He added that "certain real estate" was recorded in the personal names of employees.

99.title: Akshay can't be replaced, there's no argument: Suniel on Kartik in Hera Pheri 3
99.article_body: While talking about Kartik Aaryan's role in 'Hera Pheri 3', Actor Suniel Shetty said that actor Akshay Kumar cannot be replaced. "There's no argument...I'll sit down and understand and talk to Akki and others and see what happened," he said, adding, "I want to see if things can still fall in place."

100.title: BJP fields 40 star campaigners for bypolls to 3 seats in UP
100.article_body: The BJP has released a list of 40 star campaigners for the upcoming bypolls to Khatauli and Rampur Assembly constituencies, and Mainpuri Lok Sabha seat. The list includes Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and Deputy Chief Ministers Keshav Prasad Maurya and Brajesh Pathak. PM Narendra Modi will not be a part of the campaign.

101.title: Europe is too dependent on China for technologies: Finnish PM
101.article_body: Finnish PM Sanna Marin on Thursday said that Europe is currently too dependent on "China and other authoritarian countries" for technology. She added that Europe should be wary of this dependency. Marin further said that Europe had lessons to learn from its dependency on Russian energy, which has led to the ongoing energy crisis amid the war in Ukraine.

102.title: Alternate fuel firm Buyofuel raises â‚¹11.5 cr led by Inflection Point Ventures
102.article_body: Buyofuel, an online alternate fuel marketplace, has secured over â‚¹11.5 crore in a pre-Series A funding round led by Inflection Point Ventures. The funding round also saw participation from Venture Catalysts, LetsVenture, Lead Angels Fund, and Gruhas Proptech. The company was founded by Kishan Karunakaran, Venkateswaran Selvan, Prasad P Nair and Sumanth Kumar.

103.title: Poland's team escorted by fighter jets on its way to Qatar for FIFA World Cup
103.article_body: Poland's national football team was escorted by fighter jets on its way to Qatar for the FIFA World Cup. This comes after a missile strike that killed two men on Tuesday in a Polish village close to the Ukrainian border. Poland national team's Twitter account posted a video and wrote, "Thank you and greetings to the pilots!"

104.title: Doctor buys torch from paan shop to perform C-section delivery in Jharkhand hospital
104.article_body: A doctor at a government hospital in Jharkhand's Dhanbad was forced to buy a torch from a nearby paan shop to perform caesarean delivery in the torchlight. The surgery was conducted in torchlight allegedly due to the malfunctioned OT light. Doctors reportedly said that the OT light was not repaired even after the orders of state chief secretary.

105.title: Democratic Senators ask FTC to probe Elon Musk's handling of Twitter
105.article_body: Seven Democratic Senators have sent a letter to the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) warning that Elon Musk-owned Twitter was acting in disregard of users by announcing "new features despite clear warnings those changes would be abused for fraud, scams, and dangerous impersonation". The letter urged the agency to investigate any breach of a consent decree that FTC inked with Twitter.

106.title: Best people are staying, I'm not worried: Musk amid mass resignations at Twitter
106.article_body: After reports claimed that hundreds of Twitter employees resigned after Elon Musk gave an ultimatum, the billionaire owner of the social media platform tweeted, "The best people are staying, so I'm not super worried." Musk was responding to a Twitter user who said, "What do people mean when they say Twitter is gonna shut down? Doesn't it kinda run itself?"

107.title: Masayoshi Son personally owes $4.7 billion to SoftBank: Reports
107.article_body: SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son personally owes the Japanese conglomerate about $4.7 billion on side deals he set up at SoftBank to boost his compensation, media reports said. Bloomberg reported earlier that Son was down more than $4 billion on his side deals through the June quarter. The losses SoftBank's various investment vehicles have faced also added to Son's tab.

108.title: India records 656 new COVID-19 cases, active cases decline to 7,034
108.article_body: India recorded 656 coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases to 4,46,67,967, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare data. Moreover, the number of active cases has declined to 7,034, while the death toll has risen to 5,30,553. As per the ministry's website, the national coronavirus recovery rate has increased to 98.79%.

109.title: I was assaulted at Jadavpur University in Kolkata, says para judo medalistÂ
109.article_body: The Kolkata Police filed an FIR after a 2019 Commonwealth Para Judo Championships bronze medalist, Buddhadeb Jana, was allegedly assaulted by a former student at Jadavpur University. "[An ex-student]...started pushing me, abusing me and threatening me...He was in an inebriated state, [so] I just asked him to step back...My friend rescued me," said Jana, who is visually impaired.

110.title: Mumbai Crime Branch arrests 5 bookies for betting on T20 WC final
110.article_body: The Anti Extortion Cell (AEC) of the Mumbai Crime Branch arrested five bookies for allegedly placing bets on the final match of the T20 World Cup between Pakistan and England. The team seized eight mobile phones, SIM cards, a laptop and cash from them. A preliminary investigation has revealed that the accused sent money to Dubai through hawala.

111.title: Farooq Abdullah steps down as NCP President, says 'Health doesn't permit to lead now'
111.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah on Friday stepped down as the President of the National Conference (NC) party. Addressing party workers in Srinagar, Farooq said that his health does not permit him to lead the party now. Meanwhile, reports said that Omar Abdullah is likely to be the new party chief during the elections for the post.

112.title: Delhi sees season's coldest morning, min temp at 9.6Â°C
112.article_body: Delhi on Friday recorded its coldest morning of this season with a minimum temperature of 9.6Â°C, the India Meteorological Department has confirmed. The recorded temperature was three notches below normal. The maximum temperature is expected to settle at 26Â°C. The air quality remained in the poor category as an AQI of 275 was recorded at 9 am, according to CPCB.

113.title: Fire breaks out at Thane's Dhawal Chhaya bungalow, 68-yr-old builder rescued
113.article_body: A 68-year-old builder was rescued after a fire broke out at Dhawal Chhaya bungalow at Ram Maruti road in Thane on Thursday around 4:45 pm. Avinash Sawant, Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) chief of Thane, said that the builder was stuck on second floor of the building and was safely rescued. He added that the fire was brought under control.

114.title: Mexican state security chief, 4 others die in helicopter crash
114.article_body: The state security chief of the central Mexican state of Aguascalientes, Sanchez Mendoza, and four others have died in a helicopter crash on Thursday, the state's Governor said. Preliminary information suggested the crash was an accident, Governor MarÃ­a Teresa JimÃ©nez added. A video of the incident showed the aircraft dropping vertically into the ground of an empty grass area.

115.title: Car rams into vehicle on expressway in Maha; 5 dead, 3 injured
115.article_body: Five people were killed and three others were critically injured after a car collided with a vehicle on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway in Maharashtra's Panvel on Friday. As per preliminary reports, the accident took place due to the car driver's rash and negligent driving. A case has been filed against the car driver at the Khopoli police station.

116.title: Bihar doctor booked after video of him consuming liquor surfaces
116.article_body: A government medical officer in Bihar was booked after a video of him consuming liquor surfaced on social media. Since sale and consumption of liquor is banned in the state, a case under the Excise Act was registered against him. The doctor, however, claimed that it was an old video from Jharkhand.

117.title: Woman who participated in Quit India movement joins Bharat Jodo Yatra
117.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh has shared a video of a 93-year-old woman who participated in the Quit India movement joining the Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maharashtra. In the video, Leelabai Chitale said that she was aged 12 on August 9, 1942, adding, "People from all strata of society and religions participated." "[Chitale] wants...yatra should focus on saving Constitution," Ramesh tweeted.

118.title: 3 arrested for setting 4 vehicles ablaze in Hyderabad
118.article_body: Three persons have been arrested for allegedly setting ablaze four vehicles, including three bikes and an auto trolley, in Hyderabad. According to police, the sister of one of the suspects, identified as S Chintu, was in a relationship with K Ganesh. Seeking vengeance, Chintu, along with two others, set the vehicles on fire thinking they belonged to Ganesh, said police.

119.title: UP municipal polls candidate gives live chickens to voters, video surfaces
119.article_body: Uttar Pradesh municipal polls candidate Mohd Islam allegedly distributed free live chickens to voters in Shamli, reports said. A video of the incident was posted on social media. Reports added that Islam brought two trucks full of live chicken and distributed them. Islam said that this was his way of thanking people for making him chairman from 2012 to 2017.

120.title: Set me free like Rajiv Gandhi case convicts: Man serving life term to SC
120.article_body: Swami Shraddhanand, who is serving a life sentence for murdering his wife in the 90s, has asked the Supreme Court to release him arguing that six convicts in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case were also released. "This is a...case of violation of the right to equality," his lawyer said. The lawyer added that Shraddhanand is over 80 years old.

121.title: Someone got fish, samosas; had to eat as joint family: Suniel on Dharavi shoot
121.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said that whenever he went to shoot in Dharavi, someone got fish or samosas and everyone had to eat as a joint family. "All festivals [in Dharavi] are spent far more lavishly and with more love than we would ever spend in our apartments. We don't even know who our next-door neighbours are," he added.

122.title: TN CM visits family of footballer who died due to botched surgery
122.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin met the family of deceased footballer R Priya on Thursday and gave them â‚¹10 lakh as compensation and an allotment order for a tenement of 450 sq ft by the Tamil Nadu Urban Habitat Development Board. The teen died after an alleged botched surgery. Stalin offered a government job to one of her brothers.

123.title: Punjabi singer Babbu Maan receives death threat from gangsters
123.article_body: Punjabi singer Babbu Maan has received a death threat over the phone from the Bambiha gang. Police have increased the security of the singer. According to intelligence inputs received by the Punjab Police, the gangster group is planning to use minor boys and people who have no previous criminal record in the plot to kill singer Maan.

124.title: WhatsApp, Messenger to drive next wave of sales growth: Zuckerberg
124.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg told employees that WhatsApp and Messenger would drive the company's next wave of sales growth. He said this as he sought to assuage concerns about Meta's finances after its first mass layoffs. Zuckerberg reportedly described WhatsApp and Messenger as being "very early in monetising" compared to Facebook and Instagram.

125.title: My promotion as High Court judge delayed as I am gay: Advocate Saurabh Kirpal
125.article_body: Senior advocate Saurabh Kirpal has said that his appointment as High Court judge has been stalled since at least 2017 because he is gay. "I don't think the government necessarily wants to appoint an openly gay person to the bench," Kirpal added. He also said that the views of the government on LGBTQ issues were "outdated".

126.title: Live heart reaches Hyd hospital in 12 minutes as police create green channel
126.article_body: A live heart was transported from Medicover Hospital, HiTech City to NIMS Hospital, Panjagutta in 12 minutes after the Hyderabad and Cyberabad Traffic Police coordinated and created a green channel, reports said. The heart left Medicover at 10:10 am and reached NIMS by 10:22 am. Reports said that Hyderabad Police have facilitated organ transportation 32 times in 2022.

127.title: Blackstone files papers for India's 1st retail mall REIT IPO: Report
127.article_body: Private equity player Blackstone has filed draft papers with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) for India's first-ever pure-play retail mall real estate investment trust (REIT) IPO, Moneycontrol cited sources as saying. Blackstone reportedly plans to raise $500 million via the proposed IPO, which will involve a $200 million primary component and a $300 million secondary component.

128.title: Ayurveda startup NirogStreet raises $12 mn led by Jungle Ventures
128.article_body: Ayurveda startup NirogStreet has secured $12 million in a Series B funding round led by Jungle Ventures. The funding round also saw participation from existing investors, including Spiral Ventures, ICMG Co-Creation Fund and angel investors like DoorDash's Gokul Rajaram and Japanese bank SMBC's Asia-Pacific Co-Head Rajeev Kannan. NirogStreet was co-founded by Ram N Kumar and Robin Jha.

129.title: Delhi LG seals DDC Vice Chairman Shah's office, asks CM to remove him
129.article_body: Delhi LG VK Saxena on Friday asked CM Arvind Kejriwal to remove Jasmine Shah as the Vice Chairperson of the Dialogue and Development Commission of Delhi for allegedly misusing his office for political purposes. Further, Shah's office at Shamnath Marg in Delhi has been ordered to be sealed to "prevent access to the premises". Notably, Kejriwal is DDC's Chairperson.

130.title: Very concerning: FBI Director on secret Chinese 'police stations' in US
130.article_body: FBI Director Christopher Wray said that the US is deeply concerned about the Chinese government setting up unauthorised "police stations" in US cities to possibly pursue influence operations. In September, Europe-based human rights NGO Safeguard Defenders published a report revealing the presence of dozens of Chinese police "service stations" in major cities around the world, including New York.

131.title: Twitter temporarily shuts all offices amid mass resignations: Reports
131.article_body: Twitter temporarily shut all its offices after hundreds of employees reportedly resigned following Elon Musk's ultimatum to commit to an "extremely hardcore" culture at Twitter or leave. In an internal message, Twitter reportedly told employees that their badge access was suspended, without stating a reason for the move. It further informed them that the offices would reopen on November 21.

132.title: Twitter sued by disabled ex-worker over restriction on remote work
132.article_body: A lawsuit has alleged that Twitter's new owner Elon Musk's policy of requiring almost all employees to work from office is discriminatory against workers with disabilities. A California-based engineering manager, who was allegedly fired from Twitter after he refused to report to the office, has filed the lawsuit. He said he has a disability that makes him vulnerable to COVID-19.

133.title: Ability to do long tweets coming soon: Elon Musk
133.article_body: Responding to an 82-tweet thread, Twitter's owner Elon Musk said that ability to do long tweets is "coming soon". While he didn't provide any further details, an app researcher said that Twitter is working on a feature that will split long-form text into a thread automatically. Musk had earlier also spoken in favour of expanding Twitter's current 280-character limit.

134.title: Amazon will continue to cut jobs in 2023: CEO Andy Jassy
134.article_body: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy has said that the firm will continue to cut jobs in 2023. "Our annual planning process extends into the new year, which means there will be more role reductions as leaders continue to make adjustments," he said in a note to employees. This comes after reports said that mass layoffs have started at Amazon.

135.title: 3 arrested for kidnapping businessman in Hyderabad
135.article_body: Three people were arrested for allegedly kidnapping a businessman in Hyderabad. The victim, Rayidi Radhakrishna, had started a business with one of the accused, V Pawan Kumar, in which the latter had invested â‚¹70 lakh, said police. After some differences emerged between them, Pawan demanded his money back but Radhakrishna refused. Pawan kidnapped Radhakrishna and demanded money from his family.

136.title: Japan's core inflation rises by 3.6% to a 40-year high in October
136.article_body: Japan's core consumer inflation rose by 3.6% to a 40-year high in October as the yen pushed up the cost of imported commodities. The jump was the largest since February 1982. Governor of the Bank of Japan Haruhiko Kuroda reiterated that he would maintain monetary stimulus to support the economy still recovering from the impact of COVID-19 and facing inflation.

137.title: Seats filling fast for IIM-I's flagship online PG Diploma: UNext Jigsaw
137.article_body: IIM Indore's online Executive PG Diploma in Management & AI is designed for working professionals with 3+ years of experience to lead their teams in delivering business values with AI-driven solutions, as per UNext Jigsaw. Participants will undergo a week-long campus immersion where they can network with industry leaders & gain free access to Coursera among other benefits, it stated.

138.title: 151 notices served to mosquito breeding sites in Ghaziabad: Official
138.article_body: Regular door-to-door checks are being conducted in Ghaziabad amid a rise in the number of dengue cases, officials said. Till Wednesday, 151 notices were served at places where mosquito breeding sites were found, the district malaria officer said. "Compliance has to be ensured within 24 hours...otherwise a financial penalty will be levied," the district malaria officer added.

139.title: Jailed Putin critic Navalny sent to solitary punishment cell
139.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's jailed critic Alexey Navalny on Thursday said he has been transferred to a solitary punishment cell. Navalny said that the move took place just days before a planned family visit, and was clearly designed to shut him up. The 46-year-old is currently serving prison terms totaling 11.5 years for fraud, contempt of court and parole violations.

140.title: I turned down â‚¹3,000-crore offer to play for Saudi Arabia club: Ronaldo
140.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo, in an interview with Piers Morgan, stated he turned down â‚¬350-million (around â‚¹3,000-crore) offer to play for a club in Saudi Arabia. "What the press keeps saying, the garbage, is that nobody wants me, which is completely wrong. I was happy [at Manchester United], I was motivated to do a great season here," he added.

141.title: Car-sized turtle's fossils found in Spain
141.article_body: Researchers have discovered fossils of a car-sized dinosaur-era sea turtle in Spain. The turtle named Leviathanochelys aenigmatica was about 12 feet (3.7 metres) long, weighed a bit under two tons and lived during the Cretaceous Period. Leviathanochelys nearly matched the largest turtle on record - Archelon, which lived roughly 70 million years ago and reached about 15 feet long.

142.title: No harm in identifying new T20I captain & if his name is Hardik, so be it: Shastri
142.article_body: Ex-Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has said there's no harm in identifying a new T20I captain for the team, considering the "volume of cricket" being played in recent times. "If Rohit is already leading in Tests and ODIs, there's no harm in identifying a new T20I captain and if his name is Hardik Pandya, so be it," stated Shastri.

143.title: Woman beats female constable with footwear in Pune; arrested
143.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was arrested after she allegedly beat up a female traffic constable with footwear at Pune's Tilak Chowk. The incident occurred following an argument between the woman and the constable over the former's motorcycle being lifted, as per the police. The accused had also apparently dragged the traffic constable by her hair and torn her uniform.

144.title: Woman ticket checker greets commuters in Mumbai local, says 'God bless you'
144.article_body: A female ticket checker was seen greeting commuters aboard a Mumbai train while asking them to show her their tickets. She was also seen saying 'God bless you' to them. A video of her in the train compartment was shared online. A Twitter page called Mumbai Matters shared the video and wrote that Mumbai locals need such sincere ticket-checking staff.

145.title: Maha man gets message to pay electricity bill, loses â‚¹93,648 to fraudster
145.article_body: A 66-year-old lost â‚¹93,648 to a fraudster after he got a message about non-payment of an electricity bill in Navi Mumbai. Reports said the fraudster made him download an application and fill out details using a link. The fraudster cheated the victim from two accounts. By the time victim realised this, â‚¹73,500 and â‚¹20,148 had been deducted from two accounts.

146.title: ED raids 16 locations in Bengaluru over part-time job scam
146.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Thursday said it carried out raids at 16 locations in Bengaluru in connection with a part-time job scam. It froze 80 bank accounts with a total balance of â‚¹1 crore, it added. The agency is investigating a company which offered part-time jobs through its app called 'Super Like' but later refused to pay.

147.title: Hundreds of Twitter staff resign after Musk's 'hardcore' culture ultimatum: Report
147.article_body: Hundreds of Twitter employees have reportedly resigned after the company's new owner Elon Musk asked them to commit to an "extremely hardcore" culture. Musk had earlier sent an email to Twitter employees informing that he expected them to work "long hours at high intensity", or resign. Employees who choose to quit would receive three months of severance pay, he said.

148.title: Pant's best position is at the top, no. 4, 5 sealed by Surya, Hardik: Jaffer
148.article_body: Ahead of India's first T20I against New Zealand today, former Indian cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant should open India's innings. "Pant has batted at number four or five even for the Delhi Capitals, but those places are sealed by Suryakumar and Hardik...His best position is at the top of the order," stated Jaffer.

149.title: Actress Daljeet Kaur passes away aged 69 in Punjab
149.article_body: Veteran actress Daljeet Kaur passed away in Punjab's Ludhiana at the age of 69. She was suffering from brain tumour for the past three years and was in a deep coma for the last one year, according to her cousin Harinder Singh Khangura. Kaur had acted in several Hindi and Punjabi movies, including 'Putt Jattan De', 'Mamla Garbar Hai'.

150.title: Nancy Pelosi to step down as US House Democratic leader after two decades
150.article_body: US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi, the face of House Democrats for nearly two decades and the first woman to hold the post, will step down as the Democratic leader in the chamber. Pelosi said she will remain in Congress, representing San Francisco in the House. This comes after Republicans secured a narrow majority following the midterm elections.

151.title: CPPIB buys 1.70 cr shares of Nykaa parent worth â‚¹299 cr
151.article_body: Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPPIB) on Thursday bought over 1.70 crore shares of Nykaa's parent company FSN E-Commerce Ventures for â‚¹299 crore through an open market transaction. The shares were acquired at an average price of â‚¹175.25 apiece, taking the aggregate value to â‚¹299.35 crore. The company's lock-in period for pre-offer investors came to an end on November 10.

152.title: Iran released two Greek ships which were held in May: Report
152.article_body: Iran has released two ships with Greek flags after a near six-month-long seizure, DW News reported quoting state media in Greece. Ship tracking data indicated the vessels were moving away from the Iranian coast and towards the United Arab Emirates on Wednesday. Tehran had held the tankers in retaliation to the US seizing an Iranian oil cargo in Greece.

153.title: World's most powerful telescope captures a star being born, pic surfaces
153.article_body: The world's most powerful telescope, James Webb Space Telescope, captured the moment of birth of a star. NASA shared picture showing an hourglass shape created by a protostar called L1527. The protostar is 1,00,000 years old and is at the earliest stage of star formation. The protostar itself is hidden from view within "neck" of the hourglass shape, NASA stated.

154.title: Video shows woman Sarpanch dancing, firing in air with pistol in Haryana
154.article_body: The woman Sarpanch of Darba Kalan village in Haryana has been booked for allegedly indulging in celebratory firing, police said on Thursday. This comes after a viral video purportedly showed Santosh Beniwal dancing with two other women and firing in the air with a pistol. Notably, Beniwal was elected as Sarpanch last week.

155.title: 59-year-old British Sikh taxi driver murdered while on duty in UK
155.article_body: Anakh Singh, a 59-year-old British Sikh driver, was murdered while on duty in UK's Wolverhampton. He was found with serious injuries in Nine Elms Lane of the city and couldn't be saved. A 35-year-old man has been charged in connection with Anakh's murder. Results of a post-mortem were inconclusive, West Midlands Police stated.

156.title: Mahatma Gandhi's great-grandson Tushar Gandhi to join Bharat Jodo Yatra
156.article_body: Mahatma Gandhi's great-grandson Tushar Gandhi has said that he would join Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra on Friday in Maharashtra's Shegaon. Sharing a picture of Mahatma Gandhi and Jawaharlal Nehru on Facebook, the 62-year-old wrote, "A photograph of both our (his and Rahul's) ancestors together." Earlier, Tushar Gandhi said that he was born in Shegaon in 1960.

157.title: Wartime agreement to ship Ukrainian grain extended: UN
157.article_body: The United Nations (UN) on Thursday announced that the wartime agreement to allow the shipment of grains from Ukraine to the rest of the world via the Black Sea has been extended. The UN-brokered deal, finalised on July 22, had helped check global food prices amidst the Russia-Ukraine war. The agreement was set to expire on November 19.

158.title: 5 IIIT Basar students booked for ragging 3 juniors in Telangana
158.article_body: Five students of Rajiv Gandhi University of Knowledge Technologies (RGUKT), also known as IIIT Basar, have been booked for allegedly ragging three juniors at the institute's hostel in Telangana's Nirmal district. They allegedly beat up three students of Pre-University Course-I. They also threatened the juniors with dire consequences for not respecting seniors.

159.title: SP leader Azam Khan's name removed from electoral roll in Rampur
159.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan's name was removed from the electoral roll in Rampur, weeks after he was convicted in a 2019 hate speech case. Rampur Electoral Registration Officer (ERO) removed his name from the list after BJP bypoll candidate Akash Saxena filed a complaint against Khan. The Rampur MLA was disqualified after his conviction.

160.title: Italian church releases first-ever record of clergy sexual abuse
160.article_body: Italian Catholic bishops on Thursday released their first-ever record of clergy sexual abuse, drawing criticism from survivors who said the report only accounted for cases in the last two years. The report found 68 people presumed as accused and 89 as victims. Italy's main survivors' group Rete L'Abuso called the report "shamefully" inadequate.

161.title: Indians no longer need police clearance for Saudi Arabia visa
161.article_body: Saudi Arabia on Thursday announced that it will be exempting Indian nationals from submitting a police clearance certificate (PCC) to obtain a visa to travel to the country. Saudi Arabia announced the decision citing "strong relations and strategic partnership between the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and the Republic of India". Notably, more than 2 million Indians live in Saudi Arabia.

162.title: Sanjay Kumar Mishra gets one-year extension as ED Director a day before his retirement
162.article_body: The government on Thursday extended the tenure of Enforcement Directorate Director Sanjay Kumar Mishra by one year. The extension comes a day before his retirement. The Centre had earlier extended his tenure till November 18, 2022. This is the third extension for Mishra as the director of the federal agency.

163.title: 'World of Warcraft' to go offline in China over licensing dispute
163.article_body: Games like 'World of Warcraft' will be unavailable in China as Blizzard Entertainment ended a 14-year association with licensing and publishing partner NetEase. The partnership, which ensures that Blizzard's games meet China's strict content policies, is set to expire in January 2023. "We are looking for alternatives to bring our games back to players in the future," Blizzard said.

164.title: Shakespeare's only signed and dated portrait goes on sale for over â‚¹96 crore
164.article_body: A portrait of William Shakespeare, which is said to be the only signed and dated portrait of the English playwright, has gone on sale for more than Â£10 million (over â‚¹96 crore). A work of painter Robert Peake, the portrait is signed and dated 1608. The portrait has been displayed in London and its owner remains anonymous.

165.title: Ajay Devgn's 'Drishyam 2' collects â‚¹3 crore in advance booking
165.article_body: Ajay Devgn and Shriya Saran-starrer 'Drishyam 2' has collected â‚¹3 crore in advance booking after selling around 1.25 lakh tickets by Thursday afternoon. The film will be a sequel to Ajay's 2015 film 'Drishyam', which was directed by late filmmaker Nishikant Kamat. 'Drishyam 2', which is a remake of the 2021 Malayalam film, is directed by Abhishek Pathak.

166.title: SC to hear Gautam Navlakha, NIA's pleas on house arrest verdict tomorrow
166.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday will hear applications by activist Gautam Navlakha and the National Investigation Agency (NIA) over the apex court's order allowing his house arrest. The SC on November 10 allowed Navlakha to be placed under house arrest for a month on medical grounds. Navlakha has been jailed in connection with the Bhima Koregaon violence case.

167.title: J&K issues notices for cancelling land allotment under industrial scheme
167.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir government issued final notices to 586 entities on Thursday for cancellation of the land allotted to them under the state's 'industrial development scheme'. The notices were issued following failure of these entities to pay the land premium and execute the lease deed, an official said. Of these, 462 entities are in Kashmir and 124 in Jammu.

168.title: No truth in former Pak PM Imran Khanâ€™s conspiracy claims: US
168.article_body: The US government has again categorically dismissed ex-Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan's allegations that Washington orchestrated his ouster from office earlier this year. "As we've previously said, there has - there is not and there has never been a truth to these allegations," Vedant Patel from US State Department said, when asked about Khan's sudden U-turn on the conspiracy claims.

169.title: Daughter hasn't told me if she wishes to join films: Ajay Devgn
169.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn has said that his daughter Nysa has still not told him or Kajol if she wants to join the film industry. "She is just a teenager...As of now, she is studying overseas. If she decides to pursue a career in the film industry, it will be her choice," he added. Ajay will feature in 'Drishyam 2'.

170.title: Govt cannot make EC dance to its tunes: Kiren Rijiju
170.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said that the Election Commission is an independent body and the central government cannot make the poll panel dance to its tunes. He added that the "Election Commission of India is an impartial, transparent, empowered and independent body". Rijiju was responding to the opposition's charges that the EC acts on the BJP and government's directions.

171.title: US cannot stop us from buying oil from Russia: Pak Finance Minister
171.article_body: Pakistan Finance Minister Ishaq Dar said the US cannot stop them from purchasing Russian oil. Referring to his meeting with US State Department officials, Dar said, "We told...American officials...US cannot stop us from buying oil from Russia because...India is also buying oil from Russia." He reiterated that Pakistan will try to purchase oil from Russia on similar terms to India.

172.title: Tata plans to merge 4 carriers including Vistara under Air India: Report
172.article_body: Tata Group is considering a plan to integrate its four airline brands under Air India, as per reports. The group plans to merge Air India with full-service carrier Vistara, along with budget carriers Air India Express and AirAsia India. Reportedly, Tata Group and Singapore Airlines, the joint owners of Vistara, have agreed to a merger.

173.title: El Salvador to buy 1 Bitcoin every day starting Friday: President Bukele
173.article_body: El Salvador President Nayib Bukele took to Twitter to announce that the country will start buying one Bitcoin a day starting Friday, November 18.
