345.article_body: Aftab Amin Poonawala told police that after killing his partner Shraddha Walkar, he burnt her face to conceal her identity, according to an ANI report quoting police sources. "During the interrogation, Aftab revealed that he had learnt about all this on the internet, and also about how to hide the body from everyone's reach," the sources said.

346.title: Russia becomes India's 5th-largest trade partner, up from 25th spot: Report
346.article_body: Driven by a surge in oil and fertiliser imports, Russia has emerged as India's fifth-largest trading partner during the April-September period, up from the 25th position at the end of FY22, ToI cited official data. US and China have retained the top two positions. Trade deficit with Moscow is pegged at over $20 billion during the first half of FY23.

347.title: Actress Riya Sen joins Rahul Gandhi for Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maharashtra
347.article_body: Actress Riya Sen on Thursday joined Congress partyâ€™s Bharat Jodo Yatra led by Rahul Gandhi in Maharashtraâ€™s Akola. "Now the roads are witnessing revolution," Congress tweeted while sharing Senâ€™s pictures during the yatra. The party leaders resumed the Maharashtra leg of yatra today from Patur. Earlier, actress Pooja Bhatt also joined Rahul Gandhi for the yatra in Hyderabad.

348.title: NCB seizes drugs worth â‚¹1 crore in a week in Mumbai, 4 arrested
348.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) seized drugs, including some concealed in photo frames which were to be smuggled to Doha, worth â‚¹1 crore in different operations in Mumbai in a week, an official said. Four persons were arrested. The seized drugs include 19 kilograms of ganja, 1.15 kg of hydroponic weed, 13,500 Nitrazepam tablets and 3,840 Tramadol tablets, he added.

349.title: Bridge shouldn't have been opened: Morbi civic body to Gujarat HC
349.article_body: Gujarat's Morbi civic body has taken responsibility for the bridge collapse tragedy, which left over 130 people dead, a document shows. In an affidavit, the city's civic body stated before the High Court that the bridge "shouldn't have been opened". This comes after the court told it to reply by evening or pay costs of â‚¹1 lakh on Wednesday.

350.title: Income Tax Dept raids Bihar minister Samir Kumar Mahaseth's office, residence
350.article_body: Income Tax Department is conducting a raid at the office and residence of the Bihar Minister of Industries Samir Kumar Mahaseth in Patna. A team of 25 officials of the department are conducting the raid. The promoter of Saakaar group, who is a relative of a Bihar minister, and other top executives are also being searched, ANI reported citing sources.

351.title: EC rejects over 43% nominations for MCD polls, scrutiny continues
351.article_body: The State Election Commission rejected 1,115 nominations (43.13%) filed for the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) elections scheduled on December 4, 2022. The scrutiny continued till 10 pm on Wednesday and pending applications were being taken up on Thursday, an official said. The rejected papers were either incomplete or did not have the required proposers count, another official said.

352.title: Vijay Deverakonda promises to donate his organs, says 'My mother and I have registered'
352.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda attended an event to encourage organ donation and promised to donate his organs. "I think I'll donate all my organs...I don't see any point in wasting my organs...My mother and I have registered to donate," he said. "I'd love for it to be part of someone after me and help them in their life," he added.

353.title: Meta appoints Sandhya Devanathan as Head and VP of its India business
353.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta has appointed Sandhya Devanathan as the new Head and Vice President of its India business after Ajit Mohan's exit. According to Meta, Devanathan joined the company in 2016 and helped in building its Singapore and Vietnam businesses. Notably, WhatsApp India head Abhijit Bose and Meta India's Director of Public Policy Rajiv Aggarwal also recently left the company.

354.title: 17-yr-old raped by father, grandfather, uncle for 6 years in Pune
354.article_body: An investigation has been launched by the Pune police after a 17-year-old girl said she was raped and sexually abused multiple times by her father, grandfather and uncle over the past six years. She made the revelation before a committee on sexual harassment at her college in the city. Her 49-year-old father has been arrested.

355.title: Jharkhand CM arrives at ED office to appear in illegal mining case
355.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Thursday arrived at Enforcement Directorate (ED) office in Ranchi after he was summoned to appear before it in the illegal mining case. Soren had addressed the media before leaving for the ED office and said, "The way I'm being summoned...feels like I'll be fleeing...country." Earlier, Supreme Court had allowed Soren to challenge cases against him.

356.title: Women's wing of Shiv Sena's Uddhav faction demands ban on dating apps
356.article_body: The women's wing of Shiv Sena's Uddhav Thackeray faction held a protest in Maharashtra's Vasai, calling for a ban on dating apps after the Shraddha Walkar murder case in New Delhi. Shraddha's decision of not listening to her parents and choosing to stay with boyfriend is shocking and expresses mentality of youth today, which we condemn, former Vasai-Virar corporator said.

357.title: Infosys to give 65% variable pay for Q2 with Nov's salary: Report
357.article_body: Infosys will pay its employees 65% variable pay for the second quarter after slashing their variable pay by 30% in the previous quarter, The Economic Times reported. The variable pay will be given to all eligible employees in the November payroll cycle. Employees working in the US and Canada will get the pay alongside the second biweekly November payroll.

358.title: Note-taking app Evernote to be acquired by app maker Bending Spoons
358.article_body: Note-taking and task management app Evernote has announced that it is set to be acquired by Milan-based app developer Bending Spoons. While the terms of the acquisition weren't made public, Evernote CEO Ian Small said the transaction is expected to close in early 2023. Bending Spoons is behind mobile apps like the video editor Splice and image editing tool Remini.

359.title: Documentary announced on 'Rust' cinematographer accidentally shot by Alec
359.article_body: A feature-length documentary on cinematographer Halyna Hutchins has been announced. Hutchins was accidentally killed in an incident involving a prop gun fired by actor-producer Alec Baldwin during the shoot of their film 'Rust' in October 2021. The documentary will explore Hutchins' life and work, and has been fully authorised by her husband Matt Hutchins. Rachel Mason will helm the project.

360.title: Women sterilized without anaesthesia in Bihar, victim says 'Hurt like someone pulled nerve'
360.article_body: Women were allegedly sterilized without being administered anaesthesia at a primary health centre in Bihar's Khagaria. A woman said the pain felt like someone pulled her nerve, adding that four men restrained her during the procedure. "It is a matter of investigation. Action will be taken after probe," said Dr A Jha, civil surgeon.

361.title: DCW seeks status of CCTV installation in Delhi police stations
361.article_body: The Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) has issued notices to Deputy Commissioners of Police of all districts in the national capital seeking the status of installation of CCTV cameras in police stations. It also sought details about the number of CCTV cameras with audio recording and night vision facilities and the duration for which the recording is stored.

362.title: Hansika Motwani to get married on December 4 in Jaipur: Report
362.article_body: Actress Hansika Motwani is reportedly getting married to Mumbai-based businessman Sohael Khaturiya on December 4. Reportedly, the wedding is expected to be held at 450-year-old Mundota Fort in Jaipur, while the mehendi and sangeet ceremony will be held on December 3. The wedding will reportedly be a close-knit affair with only close friends and relatives in attendance.

363.title: Fake accounts on Twitter show challenges: Eli Lilly CEO
363.article_body: Pharmaceutical giant Eli Lilly's CEO Dave Ricks said the recent imposter Twitter account incident "demonstrates some of the challenges" on the social media platform. Eli Lilly recently lost over $15 billion in market cap because of a tweet by a fake Eli Lilly account verified with a $8 blue tick. Ricks described the incident as "disappointing".

364.title: Gujaratis are smart, they donâ€™t fall for anyone: BJPâ€™s Alpesh on Congâ€™s campaign
364.article_body: BJPâ€™s Gandhinagar candidate Alpesh Thakor will file his nomination on Thursday for Gujarat Assembly polls and he will be accompanied by CM Bhupendra Patel. On being asked if Rahul Gandhiâ€™s campaign may improve Congressâ€™ chances in polls, Thakor said, "State Congressâ€™ leaders have destroyed the party...Our contest is with Congress. Gujaratis are smart people. They don't fall for just anyone."

365.title: UAE-based baraka raises $20 million in round led by Valar Ventures
365.article_body: The UAE-based fintech firm baraka has secured $20 million in a Series A funding round led by Valar Ventures, backed by billionaire venture capitalist Peter Thiel. The funding round also saw participation from Knollwood. The Y Combinator-backed company was founded by Feras Jalbout, raised $4 million in a seed funding round in August 2021.

366.title: Rape accused SL cricketer Danushka gets conditional bail, banned from using dating apps
366.article_body: Sri Lanka cricketer Danushka Gunathilaka, accused of raping his Tinder date in Sydney, has been granted conditional bail. As part of his bail conditions, Gunathilaka will be required to report daily to a police station. He isn't permitted to use Tinder or any other dating app. The case is scheduled to return to court on January 12.

367.title: Conspiracy to destabilise govt: Hemant Soren on ED summons
367.article_body: Ahead of appearing before the ED in the alleged illegal mining case, Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Thursday said, "I am a Chief Minister. I hold a constitutional post. But the way I am being summoned it feels like I will be fleeing the country." "It can be called a conspiracy to destabilise the government," he added.

368.title: Paytm stock falls by nearly 10% after SoftBank stake sale report
368.article_body: The stock of Paytm parent One97 Communications fell by nearly 10% on Thursday after shareholder SoftBank reportedly sold 29.5 million shares or 4.5% stake in the payments company in a block deal. The company's stock dropped to its lowest since July 26. At 12:30 pm, Paytm's stock was trading at â‚¹549.35 apiece, down by 8.66% on the National Stock Exchange.

369.title: I frankly donâ€™t want to be CEO of any company: World's richest man Musk
369.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk on Wednesday remarked, "I frankly donâ€™t want to be the CEO of any company." Musk, who is the CEO of multiple companies, was answering lawyers as part of a trial challenging his $56 billion Tesla pay. Tesla shareholder Richard Tornetta sued Musk and the board in 2018 alleging that the CEO's compensation was excessive.

370.title: North Korea fired ballistic missile off east coast: South Korea
370.article_body: North Korea has fired an "unidentified ballistic missile" off its east coast, South Korean military claimed. This was North Korea's first ballistic missile firing in eight days. It comes after North Korea's Foreign Minister Choe Son Hue responded to a trilateral summit between the US, South Korea and Japan, saying accord would leave tensions on the Korean Peninsula "more unpredictable".

371.title: Narayan Rane's family begins demolition of bungalow deemed as illegal
371.article_body: Union Minister Narayan Rane's family has started the demolition of parts of their bungalow, an eight-storey bungalow located in Juhu, that were deemed as illegal construction by the Bombay HC. A company owned by Narayan Rane had earlier filed a plea with Supreme Court challenging Bombay High Court's order but it was dismissed by the apex court.

372.title: 4 suffer burns due to chemical leakage at institute in Mumbai
372.article_body: Four staff members of Mumbai's Sasmira's Institute of Design and Textiles suffered burn injuries due to a chemical leakage during a routine experiment in the chemistry lab on Wednesday. One of the victims, 20-year-old Pratiksha Ghume, suffered 72% burns. "We are trying to assess what went wrong in the lab," said a senior official from the Sasmira's Institute.

373.title: Tamannaah shuts marriage rumours, says 'everyone's scripting my life'
373.article_body: Tamannaah Bhatia has shut down rumours that she's going to get married to a businessman. "Everyone's scripting my life," she wrote on Instagram Story, which she shared in response to a paparazzo's video that speculated about the actress' marriage and relationship. She shared a video of her 'F3: Fun and Frustration' character and joked it to be her "businessman husband".

374.title: Germany-based firm Matter Labs raises $200 million in Series C round
374.article_body: Germany-based Ethereum development company Matter Labs has secured $200 million in a Series C funding round co-led by Blockchain Capital and Dragonfly Capital. The funding round also saw participation from LightSpeed Venture Partners, Variant and Andreessen Horowitz. The company's total funding has reached $458 million. Matter Labs is the developer behind Ethereum scaling firm zkSync.

375.title: 2 Mumbai residents among 3 arrested for trying to sell arms in Bhavnagar
375.article_body: Three persons, including two Mumbai residents, were arrested in Gujarat's Vadodara on Wednesday for allegedly trying to illegally sell arms to a resident of Bhavnagar district. Police are yet to arrest three others who were accompanying the prospective buyer. Two persons who hail from Mumbai arrived in Vadodara to sell a countrymade pistol as well as live cartridges, police said.

376.title: Maharashtra village bans use of mobile phones for children aged below 18
376.article_body: A village in Maharashtra's Yavatmal has banned the use of mobile phones for children aged below 18. Adding that the village school children are addicted to mobile phones, the sarpanch of the Bansi gram panchayat claimed that the decision was unanimously approved. The sarpanch also said that penalties will be levied on people who violate the decision.

377.title: Christina Applegate seen for 1st time since revealing she gained 18 kg due to MS
377.article_body: Actress Christina Applegate made her first public appearance since revealing she gained 18 kg amid her battle with multiple sclerosis. The 'Dead to Me' actress, 50, was seen while being honoured with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. Following her multiple sclerosis diagnosis, Applegate had said that she "can't walk without a cane".

378.title: Jack Dorsey posts 'Nobody knows anything' on Twitter, Elon Musk responds
378.article_body: As Twitter's new owner Elon Musk continues revamp of the social media platform, Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey on Thursday morning tweeted, "Nobody knows anything." Reacting to Dorsey's tweet, Musk wrote jokingly, "Magic 8 ball knows all". Notably, Dorsey today also said that he would not accept the position of Twitter CEO while replying to a user on social media.

379.title: They cut me out of frame: Anu Aggarwal on her 'Indian Idol 13' appearance
379.article_body: Actress Anu Aggarwal, who recently appeared on 'Indian Idol 13', said she was sad that the makers had cut her out of the frame and deleted her scenes from the episode. "I spoke enough but not a word was shown in the telecast...I don't want to get into blaming the channel, the editor or anybody at all," she expressed.

380.title: India reports 635 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 7,175
380.article_body: India reported 635 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 501 fresh COVID-19 cases. The number of active cases stands at 7,175, according to the ministry. The death toll so far has reached 5,30,546.

381.title: Won't testify before US House panel on Capitol riots: Ex-US VP Pence
381.article_body: Former US Vice President Mike Pence has said that he will not testify before the House of Representatives panel investigating the Capitol riots, adding that Congress has no right to his testimony. In an interview with CBS News, Pence said it would establish a "terrible precedent for the Congress to summon a Vice President...to speak about deliberations...at the White House".

382.title: With my immigration status, I've limited time to find a new role: Indian fired by Amazon
382.article_body: An Indian employee working as an Applied Scientist at Amazon Alexa Privacy in the US took to LinkedIn after he was fired from the company. Revealing that his entire data sciences team at Amazon Alexa had been laid off, Saurabh Vaidya wrote, "Unfortunately, with my immigration status, I have limited time to search for and get a new role."

383.title: Ghaziabad gets 2 new police stations at Crossings Republik and Wave City
383.article_body: Two new police stations were inaugurated in Ghaziabad at Crossings Republik and Wave City on Wednesday. With these new additions, the total number of police stations in Ghaziabad district now stands at 24. The Crossings Republik station's jurisdiction will include Crossings Republik, Behrampur and other localities, while Wave City station will have Dasna and Wave City, among other areas.

384.title: Myanmar releases 6,000 prisoners including ex-leader's Australian advisor
384.article_body: Myanmarâ€™s military leaders have released about 6,000 prisoners under an amnesty, including Sean Turnell, an Australian economist and former advisor to ousted leader Aung San Suu Kyi, state media reported. Former British envoy Vicky Bowman, US citizen Kyaw Htay Oo and Japanese filmmaker Toru Kubota were among those released. Prisoners were reportedly released to mark Myanmarâ€™s national day.

385.title: Goodera raises $10 million from Elevation Capital and others
385.article_body: Corporate volunteering startup Goodera has secured $10 million in a Series A funding round which saw participation from Elevation Capital, Zoom Ventures, Xto10X, Nexus Venture Partners and Omidyar Network. Former Xerox CEO Ursula Burns and Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal also participated in the round. The startup was founded by Abhishek Humbad in 2014.

386.title: Heroin & poppy husk worth â‚¹800 crore burnt in Punjab's Amritsar
386.article_body: Punjab Police destroyed 151 kg of heroin and 1,100 kg of poppy husk worth over â‚¹800 crore by burning them in a furnace in Amritsar. "The process of destruction was completed by a high-level drug disposal committee of contraband," a spokesperson said. Moreover, a drug disposal committee issued a disposal certificate for opium weighing 40.5 kg, the spokesperson added.

387.title: Blackstone to acquire 52% stake in IT firm R Systems for â‚¹2,904 cr
387.article_body: Private equity player Blackstone will acquire a 52% stake in digital information technology service provider R Systems International for â‚¹2,904 crore ($359 million). The stock of R Systems rose by nearly 18% on Thursday after Blackstone made the open offer for 48.33% stake at â‚¹245/share. Blackstone will also launch a conditional delisting offer at a price of â‚¹246 per share.

388.title: Bengal soon to have new Guv who will follow Dhankhar's footsteps: WB BJP chief
388.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar said that the state will soon get a new Governor who would follow the footsteps of ex-Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar. Prior to his appointment as the Vice President of India, Dhankhar was the Governor of West Bengal. La Ganesan took oath as the new Governor of West Bengal in July this year.

389.title: Domestic LPG cylinders to come with QR codes to fight theft and enable tracking
389.article_body: State-run Indian Oil Corporation Limited has launched a QR code-based track and trace initiative for LPG cylinders and it is expected that all domestic LPG cylinders will have QR codes on them over the next three months. "It has the potential to resolve several existing issues of pilferage, tracking and tracing and better inventory management of gas cylinders," said government.

390.title: Social media firms can make any party win election: Rahul Gandhi
390.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that "even if the EVM is secure, Indian elections may be rigged through social media". "If large social media companies want, they can make any party win an election," he said. "Systematic bias is being applied there and my social media handles are a live example of it," he added.

391.title: Tigress shot dead near Corbett Tiger Reserve, forest official booked
391.article_body: A forest official was booked after a tigress was shot dead near Corbett Tiger Reserve (CTR) in Uttarakhand's Almora district. The CTR administration said that the forest guard fired multiple rounds to scare away the animal that had strayed into a marketplace. One of the bullets hit the big cat in its right thigh, said CTR Director Dheeraj Pandey.

392.title: Fake police recruitment order goes viral in Mumbai, complaint lodged
392.article_body: A complaint was filed with the Marine Drive police station by the home department after an unidentified person created a duplicate government notification regarding police recruitment across the state and circulated it on WhatsApp. The duplicate notification had the name of the home department secretary and also the serial number of the original government order, the police said.

393.title: Women beaten with batons by police on train in Iran for not wearing hijab
393.article_body: Iranian security forces opened fire on people at a metro station and beat women on a train for not wearing hijab as protests over the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini entered a third month. Amini died in the custody of the morality police on September 16 after her arrest for an alleged breach of Iran's strict dress code for women.

394.title: 'Would you accept position as Twitter CEO?' Twitter user asks Dorsey, he says 'nope'
394.article_body: Replying to a Twitter user who asked him if he would accept the position of Twitter CEO, the social media company's Co-founder Jack Dorsey said, "Nope". Dorsey co-founded Twitter in 2006 and stepped down as the CEO in 2021. He served as the CEO between 2006 and 2008 and returned to lead Twitter in 2015.

395.title: Massive fire breaks out in market in Greater Noida; 6 shops gutted
395.article_body: About six shops were gutted after a massive fire broke out at a furniture market in Tugalpur village in Greater Noida. Vehicles of the fire department reached the site on receiving information about the incident and brought the blaze under control. No loss of life has been reported in the incident, a fire department official said.

396.title: Delhi's air quality dips to 'poor' with 249 AQI; Noida's AQI at 300
396.article_body: Delhi's overall air quality on Thursday morning was recorded in the 'poor' category with an air quality index (AQI) of 249, as per the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR). This comes a day after the AQI improved to 'moderate' category. The AQI in Noida stood at 300, while in Gurugram it stood at 235.

397.title: Crypto lender Genesis halts customer withdrawals after FTX collapse
397.article_body: Genesis Global Trading's lending arm Genesis Global Capital suspended customer redemptions in its lending business following the collapse of the crypto exchange FTX. Last week, Genesis disclosed that its derivatives unit had about $175 million in locked funds in the FTX trading account because of which its parent, Digital Currency Group, opted for an equity infusion of $140 million.

398.title: What kind of nationalism is this?: Rahul to Centre over Agnipath scheme
398.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised PM Narendra Modi-led BJP government over the Agnipath scheme, saying that 'Agniveers' will be unemployed for the rest of their lives after training for six months and working for the country for four years. "What kind of nationalism is this? They are playing with youths' sentiments in the name of Agniveer," Rahul Gandhi said.

399.title: Doesn't hamper our equation: Sunny on dating rumours with Sharvari
399.article_body: Actor Sunny Kaushal said that the dating rumours with actress Sharvari Wagh "doesn't hamper" their equation. "We understand that...these are just news headlines. It would be stupid of us to make it a reality and take it very seriously," he added. Sunny called Sharvari a "very level-headed" person, who likes to "weigh out the pros and cons" in different situations.

400.title: Bournvita's Forced Packs aim to nudge society against forcing kids
400.article_body: Bournvita shared that as a society, we often force kids to follow particular career paths, overlooking their natural potential. At Bournvita, we wanted to open everyone's eyes, so we forced the iconic Bournvita jar to be something it wasn't meant to be, it stated, adding that if you too are against forcing kids, pledge with your Bournvita Forced Pack.
